newsitem.title: FRANCE: French inflation eases in July, steady year-on-year.
newsitem.headline: French inflation eases in July, steady year-on-year.

text.p: Consumer prices fell 0.2 percent in France in July to leave year-on-year inflation steady at 1.0 percent, according to provisional monthly figures released by the national statistics institute INSEE on Tuesday.

Prices have risen 0.5 percent since the start of 1997, INSEE said in a statement, noting that discount sales at retailers had led to a fall in prices in July for shoes and clothing, and to a lesser extent for other manufactured goods.
It said food prices rose 0.3 percent in July as a fall of 0.1 percent in fresh produce prices was more than compensated by rises in meat and coffee prices.
Manufactured goods prices fell 1.0 percent in the main month for summer discount sales by retailers, with shoe and clothing prices down 4.0 percent.
Financial markets keep a passive watch on consumer prices as they remain well within the Bank of France's guideline of two percent, as it has been doing month after month for a considerable time now.
